definition: to resist/to obstruct/to hinder/to keep off/to block (a blow)/to get in the way of/cover/gear (e.g. in a car's transmission)
to rain/(of rain, snow etc) to fall/to precipitate/to wet

sentences.english: The picture shows a hawker used the police signs resist rain in Delhi.
sentences.chinese: 圖爲德里，一名小販利用警察局招牌擋雨。
沒有遮風擋雨的庇護所。

sentences.english: This new kind of sweater will protect you from the rain and cold.
sentences.chinese: 這種新款式的毛衣能夠爲你擋雨防寒。

sentences.english: They held their shopping bags over their heads just in case.
sentences.chinese: 她們把購物袋高舉過頭想擋擋雨，但還是溼透了。

sentences.english: The archway between the two buildings had been glassed over to keep from the rain.
sentences.chinese: 兩座大樓之間的拱道上覆蓋了玻璃，用來擋雨。

sentences.english: Take this umbrella. It can keep the rain out.
sentences.chinese: 帶上這把雨傘，它可以擋雨。

sentences.english: His dustcoat provided him with good protection against rain.
sentences.chinese: 他的風衣能夠很好地爲他擋雨。

sentences.english: They held their shopping bags over their heads just in case. Theygot soaked.
sentences.chinese: 他們把購物袋高舉過頭想擋擋雨，但還是溼透了。

definition: summer sleeping mat (e.g. of woven split bamboo)/CL:張|张[zhang1],領|领[ling3]
to let air pass through/to ventilate
